message: HootSuite doesn't yet support the streaming API does it?
For me I like TweetDeck because I can see, instantly, what my friends are saying.  Can HootSuite do that?  Maybe the problem is that I'm not very aware of HootSuite.
Yes, HootSuite can do that too.  The feedback Im after is why are people (you) choosing one over the other and what do they like best about the functionality for their monitoring tool of choice.
I used TweetDeck for a while, but I've since started using Seesmic.

I like Hootsuite but prefer Tweetdeck mainly because of the control I have over notifications. With Tweetdeck you can control notifications for each column, I only prefer to see alerts for what is important - Hootsuite can't do this and I find it intrusive and time consuming.

I can't make myself use Tweetdeck. I keep trying it simply for the sync-across-platform feature, but I find myself always back at Twitter's web interface. Besides the streaming API, I'm interested to see what the interest is also; I'm missing it.
Trying to revive an older topic... I'm a bit curious about this as well. The one drawback to HootSuite that I've seen is the inability to shorten links with bit.ly. Can TweetDeck do this?
I have found in the past hootsuite to be very buggy...
@matthewmink I would like to know as well if tweetdeck can shorten urls via bit.my
tweetdeck has bit.ly as an option by default and has a method for using any other url shortener http://i.imgur.com/hRIKX.png
